column4: can i say the f word here?  cuz i got  libstdc++5 and ++b but nomachine comes back with  nxclient depends on libstdc++2.10-glibc2.2; however:
Package libstdc++2.10-glibc2.2 is not installed.
++6 i meant
was that a debian package that you tried to install?
nxclient_1.5.0-141_i386.deb
i don't have that in my repos, so i suppose it could indeed be a debian package
debian packages aren't necessarily compatible with ubuntu
i was reading up on freenx and saw the nomachine link
for freenx ?
are you absolutely sure you have the package it complains about installed?
pretty sure...
ii  libstdc++5     3.3.6-8ubuntu1 The GNU Standard C++ Library v3
ii  libstdc++6     4.0.1-4ubuntu9 The GNU Standard C++ Library v3
but that's not the package it complained about, unless i misunderstood you
wasn't it complaining about libstdc++2.10-glibc2.2 ?
Package libstdc++2.10-glibc2.2 is not installed.
You mean i have to install an earlier version?
that's not an earlier version, it's just a different package
ahhhhhh  thanks dude
otherwise you wouldn't even have the *choice* of installing it from the current breezy repos
just "sudo aptitude install libstdc++2.10-glibc2.2"
